text.p: Renaissance Solutions Inc on Tuesday released preliminary first-quarter financial results that included earnings per share of $0.23 and revenues of $17.5 million.
The company also named William Jenkins its chief financial officer, replacing George McMillan.
McMillan, who was also chief operating officer, is leaving to become president and chief executive of BMG Direct, New York, a division of Bertelsmann AG.
Jenkins was formerly vice president of finance and administration for Renaissance.
McMillan has been working with Renaissance during his transition, and will participate in the company's conference call when it releases its detailed quarterly results on Wednesday, Renaissance said.
